title: Aluminium Giants Hit Major Milestone with Low-Carbon Production
summary: Montreal-based Elysis, a joint venture of Alcoa and Rio Tinto, announced a breakthrough in scaling its carbon-free 'inert anode' technology by installing it in a 450-kA cell, matching large modern smelters. This milestone advances low-carbon aluminum production, previously tested in products like Apple devices and Audi wheels, with potential for cost-competitive, sustainable operations. The technology uses inert materials to eliminate CO2 emissions and features a vertical design to extend anode lifespan.

title: Aluminum giants hit major milestone with low-carbon production
summary: Elysis, joint venture of Alcoa and Rio Tinto, achieved a breakthrough by scaling carbon-free inert anode technology for aluminum smelting. The innovation eliminates CO2 and PFC emissions through chemically inactive anodes and a vertical cell design, positioning it as a global first for the industry. It promises sustained low-carbon production competitive in a carbon-conscious economy.

title: Alcoa, Ball and Unilever pilot 'carbon-free' smelting technology in personal and home care packaging
summary: Alcoa, Ball, and Unilever partnered to pilot Elysis' carbon-free smelting technology for the first time in personal and home care packaging. This initiative tests inert anode tech to produce sustainable aluminum packaging without emissions. It advances commercialization of low-carbon aluminum in consumer goods.

title: Norway Begins Production of Recycled Aluminum License Plates
summary: Norway launched production of license plates from recycled aluminum, marking a sustainable innovation in materials use. This project promotes circular economy practices by repurposing aluminum waste. It enhances environmental sustainability in automotive and public sector applications.

title: Aluminum-air long-duration generation technology selected by Net Zero Innovation Hub for Data Centers for Groundbreaking Clean Backup Energy Initiative in Data Centers
summary: Phinergy's aluminum-air technology was selected by the Net Zero Innovation Hub for clean backup energy in data centers, chosen from over 70 proposals. The hub, including Google and Microsoft, will collaborate to scale it to MW levels for deployment. This innovation replaces diesel generators with sustainable, long-duration power using aluminum-air systems.

title: Steel - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Steel prices fell to 3,069 CNY/T on December 19, 2025, down 0.49% from the previous day, though rebar futures climbed above CNY 3,080 per ton to a two-week high amid expectations of improving steel margins in China. Falling input costs like coal and coke are supporting steelmaker profitability, with only 35% of Chinese mills profitable in November. Prices remain 4.51% lower year-over-year despite a slight monthly rise.

title: Global Iron and Steel Prices and News 20.12.2025
summary: SteelRadar provides the latest updates on global iron and steel prices, including Shanghai Futures rebar contracts showing no change at 0.00 on December 19, 2025. The platform offers real-time prices, news, analyses, and comments on the iron and steel industry. It tracks key exchanges and indices for market trends.

title: US raw steel production is up 1.1 percent - week 51, 2025
summary: US domestic raw steel production reached 1.753 million net tons for the week ending December 13, 2025, up 1.1% from the previous week at 1.734 million net tons, with capacity utilization at 76.5%. This represents a 5.3% increase from the same week in 2024. Year-to-date production through December 13 is 85.881 million net tons, up 3.4% from last year.

title: China's Steel Output Slump Meets Record Iron Ore Imports 2025
summary: China's steel production declined to 69.87 million tons in November 2025. December 2025 projection is around 121 million tons, amid record iron ore imports.

title: Steel Industry Newsletter 12/19/25
summary: The newsletter covers recent steel industry developments including POSCO’s 20% stake in Hyundai Steel’s new US mill, Nucor’s galvanized price increase, US Steel restarting Granite City Works, and Nippon Steel’s $4 billion scrap-based mill plans in the US. It also mentions AHMSA bankruptcy impacting Mexico’s steel supply.

title: Hyundai Steel brings in $582M Posco investment for Louisiana mill
summary: Posco will invest $582 million for a 20% stake in Hyundai Steel’s new electric arc furnace mill in Louisiana, set to produce 2.7 million metric tons of automotive steel plates annually starting in 2029. The $5.8 billion project supports local supply amid tariffs and growing US demand.

title: Steel industry supplier P.C. Campana moving manufacturing line to Vicksburg
summary: P.C. Campana Inc. will invest $3.43 million to relocate manufacturing lines to Vicksburg, Mississippi, creating 17 jobs over five years. The move enhances service to southern US steelmakers with products like alloyed cored wire used in steel production.

title: SAIL Turns to Danieli For IISCO Plant Expansion
summary: Danieli will supply key technologies for the Steel Authority of India Ltd.'s (SAIL) IISCO Steel Plant expansion in Burnpur, West Bengal. This upgrade supports modernization efforts in steel production technology. The project aligns with ongoing innovations in the steel sector.

title: Danieli to Upgrade voestalpine Wire Rod Austria’s Mill
summary: Danieli has been selected to upgrade voestalpine Wire Rod Austria’s mill in Donawitz, Austria. The upgrade involves advanced steel production technologies. It contributes to efficiency and sustainability improvements in steel manufacturing.

title: SKF advances sustainability goals by announcing six new decarbonized factories
summary: SKF has achieved decarbonized status for six additional factories across its global manufacturing footprint. This advancement supports broader sustainability goals in industrial manufacturing, including steel-related processes. The initiative reduces carbon emissions through innovative factory operations.

title: Copper futures hold above $5.4/lb as demand from China and US supports prices
summary: Copper futures remained near multi-month highs above $5.40 per pound, driven by strong demand from China and the U.S., with analysts citing growth in Chinese EV and energy infrastructure sectors and AI-related investment in the U.S. as supportive factors; prices have risen sharply month-to-date and year-on-year according to the site’s CFD tracking the benchmark market.[1]

title: Copper prices diverge as investors weigh US rate outlook, AI boom
summary: London Metal Exchange three-month copper dipped 0.12% to $11,764/ton but was set to close the week higher as investor sentiment balanced US rate expectations against demand impulses from an AI-driven investment boom; the report highlights mixed intraday moves amid an overall stronger weekly trend.[5]

title: Commodity Update – December 2025 (includes copper processing-fee negotiations and market context)
summary: The update reviews ongoing annual processing-fee negotiations between miners and Chinese smelters that set global copper benchmarks, noting tight ore supply after mine incidents and record-low smelter fees; it also summarizes recent LME highs, smelter capacity/utilization and broader commodity implications for 2025.[2]

title: SMM: Forecasts slight decline in copper cathode/rod operating rate for Dec 19–25
summary: Shanghai Metals Market (SMM) data notes a small expected decline in operating rates for copper cathode and rod for the week of Dec 19–25, while reporting transaction price ranges and averages in yuan/mt that showed modest day-to-day movement; the piece provides short-term supply-side operating-rate and price detail for Chinese domestic markets.[6]

title: Copper market outlook: supply shortage to keep prices elevated (research note)
source: J.P. Morgan Global Research (Copper Market Outlook)
summary: J.P. Morgan research attributes 2025’s record copper highs to supply shortages and dislocated inventories, projecting a refined copper deficit into 2026 and forecasting continued upside pressure on prices, with specific price-path projections into 2026 based on anticipated tightness and inventory dynamics.[4]

title: Capital demands soar for new copper supply
summary: Capital demands for new copper supply projects have surged due to delays and cost escalations in 13 out of 22 analyzed projects. Notable examples include Capstone Copper's Santo Domingo project in Chile, with a $910 million capex increase to boost annual copper production to 68,500 metric tons. Barrick's Reko Diq in Pakistan is set for 2028 commercial production with 377,000 metric tons annually.

title: ICSG: Preliminary data indicates that world refined copper production grew by about 4.4% during the first ten months of 2025
summary: Preliminary data from ICSG shows world refined copper production grew by about 4.4% in the first ten months of 2025. This growth reflects ongoing global supply dynamics amid rising demand.

title: Ero Files Technical Report for the Xavantina Operations
summary: Ero Copper Corp. filed a Technical Report for its Xavantina Operations, updating the NI 43-101 mineral reserve and resource estimate announced on November 4, 2025. The company operates copper mines in Brazil including Caraíba and Tucumã, alongside the gold-producing Xavantina. It is also advancing the Furnas Copper-Gold Project.

title: [SMM Copper Rod Express] SMM expects total copper rod production in December to decrease
summary: SMM expects total copper rod production in December to drop by 45,000 mt month-on-month to 1 million mt. Operating rates are anticipated to decline both month-on-month and year-on-year.

title: Nickel Falls to Over 8-Month Low
summary: LME nickel futures fell to about $14,270/tonne, marking the lowest level in over eight months as abundant supply and weak Chinese industrial demand weighed on the market; Nornickel raised its surplus forecasts and LME stocks topped 250,000 tonnes, contributing to oversupply pressure.[1][3]

title: SMM Analysis: Nickel prices fluctuated sharply this week, falling first and then rising with spot inventory increasing slightly
summary: SHFE and LME nickel moved in tandem—hitting weekly lows then rebounding—with SHFE nickel NI2601 settling at 117,180 yuan/mt on Dec 19; domestic social inventory rose slightly while downstream buying remained cautious ahead of year-end amid mixed macro cues.[2]

title: Nickel Extends Rebound After Indonesia Signals Mine Output Cut
summary: Nickel rallied after Indonesia signalled plans to cut nickel ore production for 2026, supporting a rebound from an eight‑month low; the move, alongside potential changes to ore pricing and royalty treatment, tightened near‑term supply expectations and lifted LME nickel above roughly $14,700/tonne in trading cited by Bloomberg.[5]

title: Nickel prices surge on Dec 20 amid weaker dollar, increased ...
summary: LME nickel futures reportedly jumped US$243/ton to close at US$15,356/ton on Dec 20, with spot prices also rising—moves attributed to a softer dollar and stronger risk flows supporting short‑term price strength.[4]

title: Indonesia may slash nickel output to steady prices
summary: Analysts and industry sources say Indonesia may reduce nickel output to prop up prices; despite recent declines, some market participants expect Jakarta to use production policy to push nickel back toward higher price bands, though forecasts still point to a material surplus next year.[7]

title: Nickel Prices Show Strength
summary: Asian nickel and LME contracts showed gains mid‑December with the SHFE NI2601 and LME both stronger; commentary linked nickel strength partly to broader battery demand and correlated gains in lithium markets.[6]

title: Nornickel presents metals market review
summary: Nornickel's market review projects a global nickel surplus exceeding 200 kt for both 2025 and 2026, noting resilient Class 1 production and elevated LME‑eligible inventories that are likely to keep downward pressure on prices absent demand surprises.[9]

title: Nickel Falls to Over 8-Month Low
summary: Nickel futures fell to $14,270 per tonne in December, marking its lowest level in over eight months due to abundant supply and soft Chinese industrial activity. Russian producer Nornickel raised its surplus forecasts to 240,000 tonnes for 2025 and 275,000 tonnes for 2026, with LME stocks exceeding 250,000 tonnes. Global smelting activity eased, particularly in Indonesia, but Class 1 nickel production remained resilient.

title: Nickel Extends Rebound After Indonesia Signals Mine Output Cut
summary: Nickel prices advanced for a third day, rallying up to 1.3% to $11,928 a ton following Indonesia's proposal to cut nickel ore production to 250 million tons in 2026 from 379 million tons this year. The reduction responds to a slump in nickel prices amid oversupply from Indonesia and China outpacing demand. LME nickel rose 1.1% to $14,795 a ton.

title: Indonesia may slash nickel output to steady prices
summary: Indonesia proposes a 34% reduction in nickel production to 250 million tonnes in 2026 to stabilize falling prices, as reported by the Shanghai Metals Market citing the Indonesian Nickel Miners Association. Nickel prices have declined 7-8% over the past year to $14,376 per tonne amid oversupply. Analysts forecast surpluses of 240,000 tonnes in 2025 and 275,000 tonnes in 2026 from Nornickel.

title: Talon buys nation's only nickel mine to create Midwest 'powerhouse'
summary: Talon Metals announced the purchase of the Eagle nickel mine in Michigan's Upper Peninsula and nearby Humboldt Mill from Lundin Mining to expand its Midwest operations. The deal positions Talon to increase nickel and copper production for stainless steel and EV batteries. Lundin will hold nearly 20% stake in Talon.

title: Lundin Mining Announces Sale of the Eagle Mine and Humboldt Mill to Talon Metals
summary: Lundin Mining is selling the Eagle Mine, the only primary nickel mine operating in the US, and Humboldt Mill to Talon Metals, creating a pure-play American nickel-copper company. Eagle has produced over 194,000 tonnes of nickel and 185,000 tonnes of copper since operations began, generating US$3.2 billion in revenue. The transaction unlocks synergies for shared processing and supports regional growth.
